Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to lose weight and become more active, indicating a goal to improve health through increased physical activity.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports feeling more easygoing since their heart attack, managing stress better, and handling client issues calmly. They have been practicing meditation, which has positively impacted their focus and patience with family.
Psychosocial History: The patient feels more connected to their mother and acknowledges the need for better communication with their wife, indicating ongoing efforts to improve relationships.
Physiological Observations: The patient notes improved focus and patience, attributing these changes to their meditation practice.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows positive changes in mindset and coping strategies, indicating progress in therapy.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to continue meditation and explore communication strategies with their wife.
Next Steps: The patient plans to start walking three days a week and aims to set achievable goals to maintain motivation.
